original: ‘parisuddhavacīsamācāro nu khomhi, parisuddhenamhi vacīsamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṁsena, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ nu kho mhi vacī samācārena samannāgataḥ acchiddena appaṭimasena savijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no ti
translated: ‘Is my bodily conduct pure? Am I endowed with pure bodily conduct that is irreproachable and beyond reproach? Is this quality to be found in me or not?’

original: No ce, upāli, bhikkhu parisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, parisuddhena vacīsamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṁsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro—
analyzed: no ce upāli bhikkhu parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ hoti parisuddhena vacī samācārena samannāgataḥ acchiddena appaṭimasena tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a monk’s bodily conduct is not pure, his accusers will say,

original: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā vācasikaṁ sikkhassū’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: iṅgha tāva āyasmai vācasikam sikkhassu iti itissa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: ‘First train in bodily conduct,’ they would say.

original: Puna caparaṁ, upāli, codakena bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ—
analyzed: puna caparaḥ upāli codakena bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena evam paccavekkhitabba
translated: ‘Upāli, a monk who wants to accuse another should first examine himself thus:

original: ‘mettaṁ nu kho me cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṁ, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: mettam nu kho me cittam paccupaṭṭhitam sabrahmacārīsu anāghāta sa vijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no ti
translated: ‘Is my mind of good will toward my fellow monastics, free from anger? Is this quality to be found in me or not?’

original: No ce, upāli, bhikkhuno mettaṁ cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ hoti sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṁ, tassa bhavanti vattāro—
analyzed: no ce upāli bhikkhuno mettam cittam paccupaṭṭhitam hoti sabrahmacārīsu anāghāta tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a monk does not have a mind of loving-kindness toward his fellow monastics, he will be criticized:

original: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā sabrahmacārīsu mettaṁ cittaṁ upaṭṭhāpehī’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: iṅgha tāva āyasmā sabrahmacārīsu mā ittam cittam upaṭṭhāpehi iti itissa bhavanti vattāro
translated: ‘First make a mind of loving-kindness toward your fellow monastics.’

original: Puna caparaṁ, upāli, codakena bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ—
analyzed: puna caparaḥ upāli codakena bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena evam paccavekkhitabba
translated: “Furthermore, Upāli, a monk who wants to accuse another should first reflect:

original: ‘bahussuto nu khomhi sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā🔽pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ🔽abhivadanti, tathārūpā me dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā
analyzed: bahu sutaḥ nu kho mhi suta dharaḥ suta sannicayaḥ ye te dhammāḥ ādi kalyāṇāḥ majjhe kalyāṇāḥ  pariyosāna kalyāṇā sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham  abhivadanti tathārūpāḥ me dhammāḥ bahu sutāḥ honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasā anupekkhitā
translated: ‘Am I learned, do I remember and keep what I’ve learned? Are the teachings, which are good in the beginning, the middle, and the end, which are—in their meaning and expression—complete and perfect, and which I proclaim well, well-remembered by me?🔽Do I have the view that the spiritual life is the only way, and that it gives rise to knowledge and insight, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment?

original: diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā savijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no ti
translated: Do I have the view that the spiritual life is the only way, and that it gives rise to knowledge and insight, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment?’

original: No ce, upāli, bhikkhu bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā
analyzed: no ce upāli bhikkhu bahu ssutaḥ hoti suta dharaḥ suta sannicayaḥ ye te dhammāḥ ādi kalyāṇā
translated: If a monk is not learned, he will be criticized:

original: majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ
analyzed: majjhe kalyāṇā pariyosāna kalyāṇā sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddha
translated: good in the middle, and good in the end,

original: brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti, tathārūpassa dhammā na bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā
analyzed: brahmacariyam abhivadanti tathārūpassa dhammā na bahu ssutāḥ honti dhātā vacasā paricitā
translated: and he has not learned much, has not retained what he has learned, has not made it a living experience by practice,

original: manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā, tassa bhavanti vattāro—
analyzed: manasā an upekkhitā diṭṭhiyā su paṭividdhā tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: has not inquired into it well with his mind, and has not penetrated it well with wisdom.🔽People say to him,

original: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā āgamaṁ pariyāpuṇassū’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tāva āyasmai āgamam pariyāpuṇassu iti itissa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: ‘Come, first learn the tradition.’

original: Puna caparaṁ, upāli, codakena bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ—🔽‘ubhayāni kho me pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: puna caparaḥ upāli codakena bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena evam paccavekkhitabba  ubhayāni kho me pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti su vibhattāni suppavattīni su vinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso sa vijjati nu kho me eso dhammaḥ udāhu no ti
translated: ‘And further, Upāli, a monk who is accusing another should reflect:

original: No ce, upāli, bhikkhuno ubhayāni pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni
analyzed: no ce upāli bhikkhunaḥ ubhayāni pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti su vibhattāni
translated: ‘Have I mastered the two Monastic Codes well—the Monastic Code of the monks and the Monastic Code of the nuns—in terms of the rules, their origin stories, their specifics, their resolutions, and their additions?’🔽If he has not mastered them,

original: suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, ‘idaṁ panāvuso kattha vuttaṁ bhagavatā’ti
analyzed: su pavattīni su vinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso idam pana āvuso kattha vuttam bhagavatā ati
translated: and well analyzed in terms of the discourses and the details of the discourses. When asked, ‘But where was it said?’

original: iti puṭṭho na sampāyati, (…) tassa bhavanti vattāro—🔽‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā vinayaṁ pariyāpuṇassū’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: iti puṭṭhaḥ na sampāyati tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ  tāva āyasmai vinayam pariyāpuṇassu iti itissa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: he can’t say. And there are those who say,🔽‘First learn the Monastic Law.’ And there are those who say,

original: Codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ paccavekkhitvā paro codetabbo”ti.
analyzed: codakena upāli bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattam paccavekkhitvā paraḥ codetabbo ti
translated: ‘Upāli, when a monk who is accusing another wants to accuse him, he should first review these five qualities in himself.’”

original: “Codakena, bhante, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena kati dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo”ti?
analyzed: codakena bhante bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena kati dhamme ajjhattam upaṭṭhāpetvā paraḥ codetabbo ti
translated: “Sir, when a monk who is accusing another wants to accuse him, how many qualities should he first establish in himself?”

original: “Codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo.
analyzed: codakena upāli bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattam upaṭṭhāpetvā paraḥ codetabbo
translated: “Upāli, when a monk who is accusing another wants to accuse him, he should first establish five qualities in himself.

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What five?

original: Kālena vakkhāmi no akālena, bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena, saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena, atthasaṁhitena vakkhāmi no anatthasaṁhitena, mettācitto vakkhāmi no dosantaroti—
analyzed: kālena vakkhāmi no akālena bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena attha sahitena vakkhāmi no anattha sahitena mettā cittaḥ vakkhāmi no dosantaro ti
translated: I’ll speak at the right time, not at the wrong time. I’ll speak truthfully, not falsely. I’ll speak gently, not harshly. I’ll speak beneficially, not unbeneficially. I’ll speak with a mind of good will, not with internal ill will.”

original: codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo”ti.
analyzed: codakena upāli bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattam upaṭṭhāpetvā paraḥ codetabbo ti
translated: When wanting to accuse another, Upāli, a monk should establish these five qualities in himself before accusing the other.”

original: “Codakena, bhante, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena kati dhamme ajjhattaṁ manasi karitvā paro codetabbo”ti?
analyzed: codakena bhante bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena kati dhamme ajjhattam manasi karitvā paraḥ codetabbo ti
translated: “When wanting to accuse another, how many qualities should a monk keep in mind regarding himself?”

original: “Codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ manasi karitvā paro codetabbo.
analyzed: codakena upāli bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattam manasi karitvā paraḥ codetabbo
translated: “When wanting to accuse another, Upāli, a monk should keep five qualities in mind regarding himself.

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What are the five?

original: Kāruññatā, hitesitā, anukampatā, āpattivuṭṭhānatā, vinayapurekkhāratā—
analyzed: kāruñña tā hita īsi tā anukampa tā āpatti vuṭṭhāna tā vinaya purekkhāra tā
translated: Compassion, the wish for benefit, sympathy, the clearing of offenses, and the priority of the Monastic Law.

original: codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ manasi karitvā paro codetabbo”ti.
analyzed: codakena upāli bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattam manasi karitvā paraḥ codetabbaḥ ti
translated: When wanting to accuse another, Upāli, a monk should keep these five qualities in mind regarding himself.”

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṁ kārāpentassa nālaṁ okāsakammaṁ kātun”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsa kammam kārāpentassa na alam okāsa kammam kātunti
translated: “When a monk has how many qualities, is it not suitable for him to perform the invitation ceremony?”

original: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṁ kārāpentassa nālaṁ okāsakammaṁ kātuṁ.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsa kammam kārāpentassa na alam okāsa kammam kātu  katamehi pañcahi
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, it’s not suitable for him to perform the invitation ceremony:

original: Aparisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, aparisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, aparisuddhājīvo hoti, bālo hoti abyatto, na paṭibalo anuyuñjiyamāno anuyogaṁ dātuṁ—🔽imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṁ kārāpentassa nālaṁ okāsakammaṁ kātuṁ.
analyzed: a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ hoti a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ hoti a parisuddha ājīvaḥ hoti bālaḥ hoti abyattaḥ na paṭibalaḥ anuyuñjiyamānaḥ anuyogam dātu  imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsa kammam kārāpentassa na alam okāsa kammam kātu
translated: he has impure bodily conduct; he has impure verbal conduct; he has impure livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent; he’s incapable of answering properly when questioned.🔽When a monk has these five qualities, it’s not suitable for him to perform the invitation ceremony.

original: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṁ kārāpentassa alaṁ okāsakammaṁ kātuṁ.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsa kammam kārāpentassa alam okāsa kammam kātu 🔽katamehi pañcahi
translated: When a monk has five qualities, it’s suitable for him to perform the invitation ceremony:🔽he doesn’t have impure bodily conduct; he doesn’t have impure verbal conduct; he doesn’t have impure livelihood; he’s not ignorant or incompetent; he’s capable of answering properly when questioned.

original: Parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, parisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, parisuddhājīvo hoti, paṇḍito hoti byatto paṭibalo anuyuñjiyamāno anuyogaṁ dātuṁ—
analyzed: parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ hoti parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ hoti parisuddha ājīvaḥ hoti paṇḍitaḥ hoti byattaḥ paṭibalaḥ anuyuñjiyamānaḥ anuyogam dātu
translated: He has purified bodily conduct. He has purified verbal conduct. He has purified livelihood. He is wise, competent, and capable of looking after a monk.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṁ kārāpentassa alaṁ okāsakammaṁ kātun”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsa kammam kārāpentassa alam okāsa kammam kātunti
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, he’s fit to perform the legal procedure of giving guidance.”

original: “Attādānaṁ ādātukāmena, bhante, bhikkhunā katihaṅgehi samannāgataṁ attādānaṁ ādātabban”ti?
analyzed: attādānam ādātu kāmena bhante bhikkhunā kati haṅgehi samannāgatam attādānam ādātabbanti
translated: “When a monk wants to take on a pupil, how many qualities should he look for in him?”

original: “Attādānaṁ ādātukāmenupāli, bhikkhunā pañcaṅgasamannāgataṁ attādānaṁ ādātabbaṁ.
analyzed: attā ādānam ādātu kāmena upāli bhikkhunā pañcaṅga samannāgatam attā ādānam ādātabba
translated: “When a monk wants to take on a pupil, he should look for five qualities in him:

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What are the five?

original: Attādānaṁ ādātukāmena, upāli, bhikkhunā evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ—
analyzed: attādānam ādātu kāmena upāli bhikkhunā evam paccavekkhitabba
translated: When a monk wants to take on a pupil, he should reflect,

original: ‘yaṁ kho ahaṁ imaṁ attādānaṁ ādātukāmo, kālo nu kho imaṁ attādānaṁ ādātuṁ udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: yam khalu aham imam attā ādānam ādātu kāmaḥ kālaḥ nu khalu imam attā ādānam ādātum udāhu na uti
translated: ‘Do I want to take on a pupil at the right time or not?’

original: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: sace upāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: If, by reflecting, he knows,

original: ‘akālo imaṁ attādānaṁ ādātuṁ no kālo’ti, na taṁ, upāli, attādānaṁ ādātabbaṁ.
analyzed: akālaḥ imam attā ādānam ādātum no kālaḥ iti na te upāli attā ādānam ādātabba
translated: ‘The time has not come to take up this legal issue,’ then you should not take it up.

original: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: sace panupāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: If, on reviewing it, a monk knows that

original: ‘kālo imaṁ attādānaṁ ādātuṁ no akālo’ti, tenupāli, bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabbaṁ—
analyzed: kālaḥ imam attā ādānam ādātum no akālo ti tena upāli bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabba
translated: ‘the time has come to take up this legal issue,’ then he should review it further:

original: ‘yaṁ kho ahaṁ imaṁ attādānaṁ ādātukāmo bhūtaṁ nu kho idaṁ attādānaṁ udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: yam khalu aham imam attā ādānam ādātu kāmaḥ bhūtam nu khalu idam attā ādānam udāhu na uti
translated: ‘Is this legal issue true or not?’

original: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: sace upāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: If, on reviewing it, he knows that

original: ‘abhūtaṁ idaṁ attādānaṁ no bhūtan’ti, na taṁ, upāli, attādānaṁ ādātabbaṁ.
analyzed: abhūtam idam attā ādānam no bhūtanti na te upāli attā ādānam ādātabba
translated: ‘this legal issue is not true,’ then he should not take it up.

original: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: sace panupāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: If, on reviewing it, he knows that

original: ‘bhūtaṁ idaṁ attādānaṁ no abhūtan’ti, tenupāli, bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabbaṁ—
analyzed: bhūtam idam attā ādānam no abhūtanti tena upāli bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabba
translated: ‘this legal issue is true,’ then he should review it further:

original: ‘yaṁ kho ahaṁ imaṁ attādānaṁ ādātukāmo, atthasaṁhitaṁ nu kho idaṁ attādānaṁ udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: yam kho aham imam attā ādānam ādātu kāmaḥ attha sahitam nu kho idam attā ādānam udāhu no ti
translated: ‘Is this legal issue beneficial or not?’

original: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: sace upāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: If, on reviewing it, he knows that

original: ‘anatthasaṁhitaṁ idaṁ attādānaṁ no atthasaṁhitan’ti, na taṁ, upāli, attādānaṁ ādātabbaṁ.
analyzed: anattha sahitam idam attā ādānam no attha sahitam ti na te upāli attā ādānam ādātabba
translated: ‘This self-admission is not in accordance with the Teaching and the training,’ then you shouldn’t accept it.

original: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—🔽‘atthasaṁhitaṁ idaṁ attādānaṁ no anatthasaṁhitan’ti, tenupāli, bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace panupāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti  attha sahitam idam attā ādānam no anattha sahitam ti tena upāli bhikkhunā uttari
translated: If, on reviewing, a monk knows that,🔽‘This self-admission is in accordance with the Teaching and the training,’ he should review further,

original: ‘imaṁ kho ahaṁ attādānaṁ ādiyamāno labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammato vinayato pakkhe udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: imam kho aham attā ādānam ādiyamānaḥ labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammataḥ vinayataḥ pakkhe udāhu no ti
translated: ‘If I accept this self-admission, will I get the support of other monks who are learned and masters of the tradition?’

original: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: sace upāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: If, on reviewing, he knows that,

original: ‘imaṁ kho ahaṁ attādānaṁ ādiyamāno na labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammato vinayato pakkhe’ti, na taṁ, upāli, attādānaṁ ādātabbaṁ.
analyzed: imam kho aham attā ādānam ādiyamānaḥ na labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammataḥ vinayataḥ pakkheti na te upāli attā ādānam ādātabba
translated: ‘If I accept this self-admission, I won’t get the support of other monks who are learned and masters of the tradition,’ then he shouldn’t accept it.

original: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: sace panupāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: If, on reviewing, he knows that,

original: ‘idaṁ kho ahaṁ attādānaṁ ādiyamāno labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammato vinayato pakkhe’ti, tenupāli, bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabbaṁ—
analyzed: idam kho aham attā ādānam ādiyamānaḥ labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammataḥ vinayataḥ pakkheti tena upāli bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabba
translated: ‘If I take this legal issue to the monks, I’ll get a side that’s in accordance with the Teaching and the Monastic Law.’🔽He should then consider further:

original: ‘imaṁ kho me attādānaṁ ādiyato bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṁ bhaṇḍanaṁ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṁ saṅghanānākaraṇaṁ udāhu no’ti.
analyzed: imam kho me attā ādānam ādiyataḥ bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānam bhaṇḍanam kalahaḥ viggahaḥ vivādaḥ saṅgha bhedaḥ saṅgha rāji saṅgha vavatthānam saṅgha nānākaraṇam udāhu no ti
translated: ‘If I take this legal issue, will it lead to a dispute in the Sangha, to arguments, quarrels, and disputes, to a schism, a break in the Sangha’s communal living, a difference in the Monastic Code recited by the Sangha?’

original: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—🔽‘imaṁ kho me attādānaṁ ādiyato bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṁ bhaṇḍanaṁ kalaho
analyzed: sace upāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti  imam kho me attā ādānam ādiyataḥ bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānam bhaṇḍanam kalahaḥ
translated: If, after considering this, he knows,

original: viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṁ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, na
analyzed: viggahaḥ vivādaḥ saṅgha bhedaḥ saṅgha rāji saṅgha vavatthānam saṅgha nānākaraṇanti na
translated: ‘If I take this legal issue, it will lead to a dispute in the Sangha, to arguments, quarrels, and disputes, to a schism, a break in the Sangha’s communal living, a difference in the Monastic Code recited by the Sangha,’

original: taṁ, upāli, attādānaṁ ādātabbaṁ.
analyzed: te upāli attā ādānam ādātabba
translated: then he shouldn’t take it.

original: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: sace panupāli bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: If, after considering this, he knows,

original: ‘imaṁ kho me attādānaṁ ādiyato na bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṁ bhaṇḍanaṁ kalaho
analyzed: imam kho me attā ādānam ādiyataḥ na bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānam bhaṇḍanam kalahaḥ
translated: ‘If I take this legal issue, it won’t lead to a dispute in the Sangha, to arguments, quarrels, and disputes, to a schism, a break in the Sangha’s communal living, a difference in the Monastic Code recited by the Sangha,’

original: viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṁ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, taṁ
analyzed: viggahaḥ vivādaḥ saṅgha bhedaḥ saṅgha rāji saṅgha vavatthānam saṅgha nānākaraṇanti ta
translated: a dispute, a squabble, a clash, a legal issue, a split in the Sangha, a crack in the Sangha, a falling apart in the Sangha, a division in the Sangha.”

original: ādātabbaṁ, upāli, attādānaṁ.
analyzed: ādātabba upāli attādāna
translated: “You should accept it, Upāli, and then memorize it.”

original: Evaṁ pañcaṅgasamannāgataṁ kho, upāli, attādānaṁ ādinnaṁ pacchāpi avippaṭisārakaraṁ bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: evam pañcaṅga samannāgatam kho upāli attā ādānam ādinnam pacchā api a vippaṭisāra karam bhavissati iti
translated: “If you accept it with these five factors, you won’t regret it later.”

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāro hotī”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante aṅgehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu adhikaraṇa jātānam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāraḥ hoti iti
translated: “When a monk has how many qualities, is he helpful to monks who are having a legal issue?”

original: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāro hoti.
analyzed: pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu adhikaraṇa jātānam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāraḥ hoti
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, he’s helpful to monks who are having a legal issue.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?🔽Sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;🔽bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo;
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi  sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu  bahu sutaḥ hoti suta dharaḥ suta sannicayaḥ
translated: What five?

original: ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ
analyzed: ye te dhammā ādi kalyāṇā majjhe kalyāṇā pariyosāna kalyāṇā sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇa
translated: He’s virtuous; he lives restrained by the Monastic Code; he’s one who promotes harmony, who doesn’t create divisions in the Sangha; he’s learned; he’s one who learns the Monastic Code; he’s one who learns the Monastic Code well; he’s one who memorizes the Monastic Code; he’s one who memorizes the Monastic Code well; he’s one who has memorized the Monastic Code; he’s one who has memorized the Monastic Code well; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code well; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code well and in detail; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code well and in detail, and he’s learned in the summary matters; he’s one who knows the summary matters; he’s one who knows the summary matters well; he’s one who knows the summary matters well and in detail; he’s one who knows the summary matters well and in detail, and he’s learned in the Monastic Code; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code well; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code well and in detail; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code well and in detail, and he’s learned in the Monastic Code in brief and in detail; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code in brief and in detail; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code in brief and in detail well; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code in brief and in detail well and in detail, and he’s learned in the Monastic Code in brief and in detail; he’s one who knows the Monastic Code in brief and

original: parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti tathārūpassa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā
analyzed: parisuddham brahmacariyam abhivadanti tathārūpassa dhammā bahu ssutāḥ honti dhātā vacasā
translated: and they praise his celibate life, then he has learned much, remembered what he has learned, and accumulated it.

original: paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni
analyzed: paricitā manasā anupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā su paṭividdhā ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni
translated: He has examined it with his mind, developed views, and penetrated it well with wisdom. He has both the Monastic Code and the additional rules.

original: vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso;
analyzed: vitthārena svāgatāni honti su vibhattāni su pavattīni su vinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso
translated: He has properly learned them, properly scrutinized them, properly penetrated them, properly clarified them, and properly remembered them.

original: vinaye kho pana ṭhito hoti asaṁhīro;
analyzed: vinaye kho pana ṭhitaḥ hoti a sahīraḥ
translated: He is established in the Monastic Law, and is not contemptible in regard to it.

original: paṭibalo hoti ubho atthapaccatthike assāsetuṁ saññāpetuṁ nijjhāpetuṁ pekkhetuṁ pasādetuṁ—
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti ubho attha paccatthike assāsetum saññāpetum nijjhāpetum pekkhetum pasādetu
translated: He is able to convince both sides and make them trust him.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāro hoti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu adhikaraṇa jātānam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāraḥ hoti
translated: A monk with these five qualities is helpful to monks who are arguing.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāro hoti.
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu adhikaraṇa jātānam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāraḥ hoti
translated: A monk with another five qualities is helpful to monks who are arguing.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What five?

original: Parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, parisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, parisuddhājīvo hoti, paṇḍito hoti byatto, paṭibalo anuyuñjiyamāno anuyogaṁ dātuṁ—
analyzed: parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ hoti parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ hoti parisuddha ājīvaḥ hoti paṇḍitaḥ hoti byattaḥ paṭibalaḥ anuyuñjiyamānaḥ anuyogam dātu
translated: He has purified bodily conduct, he has purified verbal conduct, he has purified livelihood, he is wise, skilled, and able to explain the Teaching, to give a connected and coherent explanation of it—

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāro hoti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu adhikaraṇa jātānam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāraḥ hoti
translated: a monk with these five qualities is helpful to monks who are having a legal issue.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāro hoti.
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu adhikaraṇa jātānam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāraḥ hoti
translated: A monk with five other qualities is helpful to monks who are having a legal issue.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What five?

original: Vatthuṁ jānāti, nidānaṁ jānāti, paññattiṁ jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṁ jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: vatthum jānāti nidānam jānāti paññattim jānāti pada paccābhaṭṭham jānāti anusandhi vacana patham jānāti
translated: He knows the rule, he knows the background to the rule, he knows the subject matter of the rule, he knows the rule’s phrasing, he knows the offense.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāro hotī”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu adhikaraṇa jātānam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāraḥ hoti iti
translated: A monk with these five qualities is helpful to monks who are having a legal issue.”

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anuyuñjitabbanti
translated: “When a monk has how many qualities, should he not be pressed?”

original: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anuyuñjitabba
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, he should not be pressed:

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Suttaṁ na jānāti, suttānulomaṁ na jānāti, vinayaṁ na jānāti, vinayānulomaṁ na jānāti, na ca ṭhānāṭhānakusalo hoti—
analyzed: suttam na jānāti sutta anulomam na jānāti vinayam na jānāti vinaya anulomam na jānāti na ca ṭhāna aṭhāna kusalaḥ hoti
translated: He doesn’t know the discourses, nor what’s in accordance with the discourses, nor the training, nor what’s in accordance with the training, and he’s not skilled in the details and the sequence of the discourses and the training.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has these five qualities should not be pressed.

original: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahupāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has five qualities may be pressed.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Suttaṁ jānāti, suttānulomaṁ jānāti, vinayaṁ jānāti, vinayānulomaṁ jānāti, ṭhānāṭhānakusalo ca hoti—
analyzed: suttam jānāti sutta anulomam jānāti vinayam jānāti vinaya anulomam jānāti ṭhāna aṭhāna kusalaḥ ca hoti
translated: He knows the discourses, what’s in accordance with the discourses, the training, what’s in accordance with the training, and he’s skilled in the details and the sequence of the discourses and the training.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has these five qualities may be pressed.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has five other qualities should not be pressed.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Dhammaṁ na jānāti, dhammānulomaṁ na jānāti, vinayaṁ na jānāti, vinayānulomaṁ na jānāti, na ca pubbāparakusalo hoti—
analyzed: dhammam na jānāti dhamma anulomam na jānāti vinayam na jānāti vinaya anulomam na jānāti na ca pubba apara kusalaḥ hoti
translated: He doesn’t know the Teaching, nor what’s in accordance with the Teaching, nor the training, nor what’s in accordance with the training, and he’s not skilled in the sequence of the Teaching and the training.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has these five qualities should not be pressed.

original: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahupāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has five qualities may be pressed.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Dhammaṁ jānāti, dhammānulomaṁ jānāti, vinayaṁ jānāti, vinayānulomaṁ jānāti, pubbāparakusalo ca hoti—
analyzed: dhammam jānāti dhamma anulomam jānāti vinayam jānāti vinaya anulomam jānāti pubba apara kusalaḥ ca hoti
translated: He knows the Teaching, he knows what is in accordance with the Teaching, he knows the Monastic Law, he knows what is in accordance with the Monastic Law, and he is skilled in the sequence of the Monastic Law.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has these five qualities may be pressed.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has five other qualities should not be pressed.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Vatthuṁ na jānāti, nidānaṁ na jānāti, paññattiṁ na jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṁ na jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṁ na jānāti—
analyzed: vatthum na jānāti nidānam na jānāti paññattim na jānāti pada paccābhaṭṭham na jānāti anusandhi vacana patham na jānāti
translated: He doesn’t know the rule, he doesn’t know the origin stories for the rules, he doesn’t know the sequence of offenses, he doesn’t know the phrasing of the rules, and he doesn’t know what is allowable and what is not.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has these five qualities should not be pressed.

original: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahupāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk who has five qualities may be pressed.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Vatthuṁ jānāti, nidānaṁ jānāti, paññattiṁ jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṁ jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṁ jānāti—
analyzed: vatthum jānāti nidānam jānāti paññattim jānāti pada paccābhaṭṭham jānāti anusandhi vacana patham jānāti
translated: He knows the rule, he knows the origin story for the rule, he knows the content of the rule, he knows the analysis of the rule, he knows the conclusion to the rule.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk should be pressed if he has these five qualities.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā  katamehi pañcahi
translated: A monk should not be pressed if he has another five qualities.

original: Āpattiṁ na jānāti, āpattisamuṭṭhānaṁ na jānāti, āpattiyā payogaṁ na jānāti, āpattiyā vūpasamaṁ na jānāti, āpattiyā na vinicchayakusalo hoti—
analyzed: āpattim na jānāti āpatti samuṭṭhānam na jānāti āpattiyāḥ payogam na jānāti āpattiyāḥ vūpasamam na jānāti āpattiyāḥ na vinicchaya kusalaḥ hoti
translated: If he doesn’t know the offense, if he doesn’t know the origin story for the offense, if he doesn’t know the performance that’s the basis for the offense, if he doesn’t know the origin story for the offense, if he doesn’t know the conclusion to the offense.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk should not be pressed if he has these five qualities.

original: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: pañcahupāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā  katamehi pañcahi
translated: A monk should be pressed if he has five qualities.

original: Āpattiṁ jānāti, āpattisamuṭṭhānaṁ jānāti, āpattiyā payogaṁ jānāti, āpattiyā vūpasamaṁ jānāti, āpattiyā vinicchayakusalo hoti—
analyzed: āpattim jānāti āpatti samuṭṭhānam jānāti āpattiyāḥ payogam jānāti āpattiyāḥ vūpasamam jānāti āpattiyāḥ vinicchaya kusalaḥ hoti
translated: If he knows the offense, if he knows the origin story for the offense, if he knows the performance that’s the basis for the offense, if he knows the origin story for the offense, if he knows the conclusion to the offense.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.🔽Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā  aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: A monk should be pressed if he has these five qualities.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: “Upāli, a monk should not be pressed if he has five qualities.🔽If he doesn’t know the legal issues;🔽if he doesn’t know the origins of the legal issues;🔽if he doesn’t know the expression of the legal issues;🔽if he doesn’t know the settling of the legal issues;

original: Adhikaraṇaṁ na jānāti, adhikaraṇasamuṭṭhānaṁ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa payogaṁ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vūpasamaṁ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa na vinicchayakusalo hoti—🔽imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: adhikaraṇam na jānāti adhikaraṇa samuṭṭhānam na jānāti adhikaraṇassa payogam na jānāti adhikaraṇassa vūpasamam na jānāti adhikaraṇassa na vinicchaya kusalaḥ hoti  imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā
translated: if he’s not skilled in legal procedures.🔽A monk should be pressed if he has five qualities:🔽if he knows the legal issues;

original: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṁ.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: pañcahupāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā  katamehi pañcahi
translated: if he knows the origins of the legal issues;🔽if he knows the expression of the legal issues;🔽if he knows the settling of the legal issues;

original: Adhikaraṇaṁ jānāti, adhikaraṇasamuṭṭhānaṁ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa payogaṁ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vūpasamaṁ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vinicchayakusalo hoti—
analyzed: adhikaraṇam jānāti adhikaraṇa samuṭṭhānam jānāti adhikaraṇassa payogam jānāti adhikaraṇassa vūpasamam jānāti adhikaraṇassa vinicchaya kusalaḥ hoti
translated: if he’s skilled in legal procedures.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabban”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbanti
translated: A monk should be pressed if he has these five qualities.”

original: Attādānavaggo niṭṭhito pañcamo.
analyzed: attādāna vaggaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ pañcamaḥ
translated: The fifth sub-chapter on taking back what one has given is finished.

original: Tassuddānaṁ🔽Parisuddhañca kālena,
analyzed: tassa uddāna  parisuddham ca kālena
translated: The summary:🔽Pure, and in a timely way,🔽Compassion, and with an opportunity,

original: Kāruññaṁ okāsena ca;🔽Attādānaṁ adhikaraṇaṁ,
analyzed: kāruññam okāsena ca  attā ādānam adhikaraṇa
translated: Taking back what one has given, and legal issues,

original: Aparehipi vatthuñca;
analyzed: aparehipi vatthuñca
translated: And with other grounds,

original: Suttaṁ dhammaṁ puna vatthuñca,🔽Āpatti adhikaraṇena cāti.
analyzed: suttam dhammam puna vatthuñca  āpatti adhikaraṇena ca ati
translated: Monks, and with grounds,🔽And with offenses, and with legal issues.

original: 6. Dhutaṅgavagga
analyzed: dhutaṅga vagga
translated: The sub-chapter on the ascetic practices

original: “Kati nu kho, bhante, āraññikā”ti?
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante āraññikā ati
translated: “Sir, how many kinds of wilderness dwellers are there?”

original: “Pañcime, upāli, āraññikā.🔽Katame pañca?🔽Mandattā momūhattā āraññiko hoti, pāpiccho icchāpakato āraññiko hoti, ummādā cittakkhepā🔽āraññiko hoti, vaṇṇitaṁ buddhehi buddhasāvakehīti āraññiko hoti, api ca appicchaññeva
analyzed: pañcime upāli āraññikā  katame pañca  manda ttā momūha ttā āraññikaḥ hoti pāpicchaḥ icchā pakataḥ āraññikaḥ hoti ummādā citta kkhepā  āraññikaḥ hoti vaṇṇitam buddhehi buddha sāvakehi iti āraññikaḥ hoti api ca
translated: “There are five kinds of wilderness dwellers:

original: nissāya santuṭṭhiññeva nissāya, sallekhaññeva nissāya pavivekaññeva nissāya idamatthitaññeva🔽nissāya āraññiko hoti—
analyzed: nissāya santuṭṭhiññā iva nissāya sallekhaññā iva nissāya pavivekaññā iva nissāya idam atthitaññā iva  nissāya āraññikaḥ hoti
translated: One who is a wilderness dweller because of being foolish and confused; one who is a wilderness dweller because of bad desires and discontent; one who is a wilderness dweller because of insanity and derangement; one who is a wilderness dweller because of the praise of the Buddhas and the Buddha’s disciples; one who is a wilderness dweller because of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, desire for solitude, and a desire to give up bad friends and make friends with good ones.

original: ime kho, upāli, pañca āraññikā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho upāli pañca āraññikā ati
translated: These are the five kinds of wilderness dwellers.”🔽“Sir, how many kinds of almsfood eaters are there?”

original: “Kati nu kho, bhante, piṇḍapātikāti …pe…🔽kati nu kho, bhante, paṁsukūlikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante piṇḍapātikā ati pe 🔽kati nu kho bhante pasukūlikā ati pe
translated: “There are five kinds of almsfood eaters:🔽One who is an almsfood eater because of being foolish and confused; one who is an almsfood eater because of bad desires and discontent; one who is an almsfood eater because of insanity and derangement; one who is an almsfood eater because of the praise of the Buddhas and the Buddha’s disciples; one who is an almsfood eater because of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, desire for solitude, and a desire to give up bad friends and make friends with good ones.🔽These are the five kinds of almsfood eaters.”

original: kati nu kho, bhante, rukkhamūlikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante rukkhamūlikā ati pe
translated: “How many people live at the foot of a tree?” …

original: kati nu kho, bhante, sosānikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante sosānikā ati pe
translated: “How many people live in a charnel ground?” …

original: kati nu kho, bhante, abbhokāsikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante abbhokāsikā ati pe
translated: “How many people are in the open air?” …

original: kati nu kho, bhante, tecīvarikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante tecīvarikā ati pe
translated: “How many people have three robes?” …

original: kati nu kho, bhante, sapadānacārikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante sa padāna cārikā ati pe
translated: “How many people wander by way of families?” …

original: kati nu kho, bhante, nesajjikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante nesajjikā ati pe
translated: “How many people never lie down?” …

original: kati nu kho, bhante, yathāsanthatikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante yathā santhatikā ati pe
translated: “How many people have what they need because of the place?” …

original: kati nu kho, bhante, ekāsanikāti …pe…🔽kati nu kho, bhante, khalupacchābhattikāti …pe…
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante ekā āsanikā ati pe  kati nu kho bhante khalu pacchābhattikā ati pe
translated: “How many people have one seat?” …🔽“How many people eat in one part of the day?” …

original: kati nu kho, bhante, pattapiṇḍikā”ti?
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante patta piṇḍikā ati
translated: “How many people eat what they get by way of alms?”

original: “Pañcime, upāli, pattapiṇḍikā.
analyzed: pañcime upāli patta piṇḍikā
translated: “There are five people who eat what they get by way of alms.

original: Katame pañca?🔽Mandattā momūhattā pattapiṇḍiko hoti, pāpiccho icchāpakato pattapiṇḍiko hoti, ummādā
analyzed: katame pañca  mandattā momūhattā patta piṇḍiko hoti pāpiccho icchā pakato patta piṇḍiko hoti ummādā
translated: What are the five?

original: cittakkhepā pattapiṇḍiko hoti, vaṇṇitaṁ buddhehi buddhasāvakehīti pattapiṇḍiko hoti,
analyzed: cittakkhepā patta piṇḍikaḥ hoti vaṇṇitam buddhehi buddha sāvakehi iti patta piṇḍikaḥ hoti
translated: There is the person who eats what he gets by way of alms because of foolishness and folly. There is the person who eats what he gets by way of alms because of bad desires and because of being overcome by desire. There is the person who eats what he gets by way of alms because of insanity and derangement. There is the person who eats what he gets by way of alms because it is praised by the Buddhas and their disciples.

original: api ca appicchaññeva nissāya santuṭṭhiññeva nissāya sallekhaññeva nissāya pavivekaññeva
analyzed: api ca appicchaññā iva nissāya santuṭṭhiññā iva nissāya sallekhaññā iva nissāya pavivekaññā iva
translated: But someone who is content, secluded, detached, and has a sense of urgency only goes for alms in the bowl out of fewness of wishes.

original: nissāya idamatthitaññeva nissāya pattapiṇḍiko hoti—
analyzed: nissāya nissāya patta piṇḍiko hoti
translated: They do this out of fewness of wishes, being content, having an awareness of the difficulty of making a living, wanting to be free from all obligations, and wanting to be independent.

original: ime kho, upāli, pañca pattapiṇḍikā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho upāli pañca patta piṇḍikā ati
translated: These are the five kinds of alms-food eaters.”

original: Dhutaṅgavaggo niṭṭhito chaṭṭho.🔽Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: dhutaṅga vaggaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ  tassa uddāna
translated: The sixth sub-chapter on ascetic practices is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Āraññiko piṇḍipaṁsu,🔽Rukkhasusānapañcamaṁ;🔽Abbho tecīvarañceva,🔽Sapadānanesajjikā;
analyzed: āraññikaḥ piṇḍipasu  rukkha susāna pañcama  abbho te cīvaram ca iva  sa pada ānanesajjikā
translated: Forest-dweller, one who only eats alms-food, one who only wears rag-robes,

original: Santhatekāsanañceva,
analyzed: santhatā ika āsanam ca iva
translated: One who only has three robes, one who only has the standard robe-cloth, one who only has the standard almsbowl, one who only has one shoulder covered,

original: Khalupacchā pattapiṇḍikāti.
analyzed: khalu pacchā patta piṇḍikā ati
translated: One who only sits, one who only eats what is brought, one who only eats alms-food.

original: 7. Musāvādavagga
analyzed: musā vāda vagga
translated: The sub-chapter on lying

original: “Kati nu kho, bhante, musāvādā”ti?
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante musāvādāti
translated: “How many kinds of lying are there?”

original: “Pañcime, upāli, musāvādā.🔽Katame pañca?
analyzed: pañcime upāli musā vādā  katame pañca
translated: “There are five kinds of lying:

original: Atthi musāvādo pārājikagāmī, atthi musāvādo saṅghādisesagāmī, atthi musāvādo thullaccayagāmī, atthi musāvādo pācittiyagāmī, atthi musāvādo dukkaṭagāmī—
analyzed: atthi musāvādaḥ pārājika gāmī atthi musāvādaḥ saṅgha ādisesa gāmī atthi musāvādaḥ thullaccaya gāmī atthi musāvādaḥ pācittiya gāmī atthi musāvādaḥ dukkaṭa gāmī
translated: lying that leads to a grave offense, lying that leads to an offense entailing suspension, lying that leads to a serious offense, lying that leads to an offense entailing confession, and lying that leads to an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ime kho, upāli, pañca musāvādā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho upāli pañca
translated: These are the five kinds of lying.”

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṁ vā🔽pavāraṇaṁ vā ṭhapentassa—‘alaṁ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṁ, mā kalahaṁ, mā viggahaṁ, mā
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅgha majjhe uposatham vā  pavāraṇam vā ṭhapentassa ala bhikkhu mā bhaṇḍana mā kalaha mā viggaha mā
translated: “When a monk has how many qualities, should he cancel the observance-day ceremony🔽or the invitation ceremony in the midst of the Sangha, saying: ‘Enough, I won’t argue, quarrel, or fight,🔽or

original: vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā”ti?🔽“Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṁ vā pavāraṇaṁ🔽vā ṭhapentassa—‘alaṁ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṁ, mā kalahaṁ, mā viggahaṁ, mā vivādan’ti
analyzed: vivādanti omadditvā saṅghena uposathaḥ vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā ati  pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅgha majjhe uposatham vā pavāraṇa  vā ṭhapentassa ala bhikkhu mā bhaṇḍana mā kalaha mā viggaha mā vivādanti
translated: “If a monk has how many qualities, should the Sangha, after pressing him, do the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony in the midst of the Sangha, saying, ‘Enough, monk. Don’t cause a schism in the Sangha. Don’t be a party to a schism in the Sangha. The Sangha is united’?”

original: omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā.
analyzed: omadditvā saṅghena uposathaḥ vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā
translated: “If a monk has five qualities, should the Sangha, after pressing him, do the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony in the midst of the Sangha, saying, ‘Enough, monk. Don’t cause a schism in the Sangha. Don’t be a party to a schism in the Sangha. The Sangha is united.’

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca, cāvanādhippāyo vattā hoti, no vuṭṭhānādhippāyo—
analyzed: alajjī ca hoti bālo ca apakatatto ca cāvana adhippāyaḥ vattā hoti no vuṭṭhāna adhippāyaḥ
translated: He is shameless, ignorant, and incompetent; he speaks with the aim of criticizing; he does not speak with the aim of settling.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṁ vā pavāraṇaṁ vā ṭhapentassa—
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅgha majjhe uposatham vā pavāraṇam vā ṭhapentassa
translated: If a monk has these five qualities, should the Sangha, after pressing him, do the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony in the midst of the Sangha, saying, ‘Enough, monk. Don’t cause a schism in the Sangha. Don’t be a party to a schism in the Sangha. The Sangha is united.’

original: ‘alaṁ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṁ, mā kalahaṁ, mā viggahaṁ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā.
analyzed: ala bhikkhu mā bhaṇḍana mā kalaha mā viggaha mā vivādanti omadditvā saṅghena uposathaḥ vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā
translated: ‘Enough, monk. Don’t cause a schism in the Sangha.’ And the Sangha should then do the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṁ vā🔽pavāraṇaṁ vā ṭhapentassa—‘alaṁ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṁ, mā kalahaṁ, mā viggahaṁ, mā
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅgha majjhe uposatham vā  pavāraṇam vā ṭhapentassa ala bhikkhu mā bhaṇḍana mā kalaha mā viggaha mā
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, cancel his observance-day ceremony or his invitation ceremony in the midst of the Sangha:

original: vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā.
analyzed: vivādanti omadditvā saṅghena uposathaḥ vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā
translated: ‘Enough, monk. Don’t cause a schism in the Sangha.’ And the Sangha should then do the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Aparisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, aparisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, aparisuddhājīvo hoti, bālo hoti abyatto, bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako—🔽imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṁ vā
analyzed: a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ hoti a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ hoti a parisuddha ājīvaḥ hoti bālaḥ hoti abyattaḥ bhaṇḍana kārakaḥ hoti kalaha kārakaḥ  imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅgha majjhe uposatham vā
translated: He has impure bodily conduct; he has impure verbal conduct; he has impure livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent; he’s quarrelsome and argumentative, and he creates legal issues in the Sangha.🔽When a monk has these five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, cancel his observance-day ceremony or his invitation ceremony in the midst of the Sangha:

original: pavāraṇaṁ vā ṭhapentassa—‘alaṁ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṁ, mā kalahaṁ, mā viggahaṁ, mā
analyzed: pavāraṇam vā ṭhapentassa ala bhikkhu mā bhaṇḍana mā kalaha mā viggaha mā
translated: ‘Enough, monk. Don’t cause a schism in the Sangha.’🔽And the Sangha should then do the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony.

original: vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā”ti.
analyzed: vivādanti omadditvā saṅghena uposathaḥ vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā ati
translated: and then the monastics can do the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony.”

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo na dātabbo”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogaḥ na dātabbaḥ iti
translated: “Sir, when a monk has how many qualities, should his consent not be given for him to be a tutor?”

original: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo na dātabbo.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogaḥ na dātabbaḥ  katamehi pañcahi
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, his consent shouldn’t be given for him to be a tutor:

original: Āpattānāpattiṁ na jānāti, lahukagarukaṁ āpattiṁ na jānāti, sāvasesānavasesaṁ āpattiṁ na jānāti, duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṁ āpattiṁ na jānāti, sappaṭikammāpaṭikammaṁ āpattiṁ na jānāti—
analyzed: āpatta anāpattim na jānāti lahuka garukam āpattim na jānāti sa avasesa anavasesam āpattim na jānāti duṭṭhulla aduṭṭhullam āpattim na jānāti sa paṭikamma apaṭikammam āpattim na jānāti
translated: he doesn’t know what is an offense; he doesn’t know what is not an offense; he doesn’t know what is a light offense; he doesn’t know what is a heavy offense; he doesn’t know what is an offense that can be done away with and what is an offense that can’t be done away with.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo na dātabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogaḥ na dātabbaḥ
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, his consent shouldn’t be given for him to be a tutor.

original: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo dātabbo.
analyzed: pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: When a monk has five qualities, his consent should be given for him to be a tutor:

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: he knows what is an offense; he knows what is not an offense; he knows what is a light offense; he knows what is a heavy offense; he knows what is an offense that can be done away with and what is an offense that can’t be done away with.

original: Āpattānāpattiṁ jānāti, lahukagarukaṁ āpattiṁ jānāti, sāvasesānavasesaṁ āpattiṁ jānāti, duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṁ āpattiṁ jānāti, sappaṭikammāpaṭikammaṁ āpattiṁ jānāti—
analyzed: āpatta anāpattim jānāti lahuka garukam āpattim jānāti sa avasesa anavasesam āpattim jānāti duṭṭhulla aduṭṭhullam āpattim jānāti sa paṭikamma apaṭikammam āpattim jānāti
translated: He knows what is an offense and what is not an offense; he knows the light and heavy offenses; he knows the curable and incurable offenses; he knows the grave and minor offenses; he knows offenses that have and have not been confessed.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo dātabbo”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogaḥ dātabbaḥ iti
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, he should be given permission to correct others.”

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, ākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjatī”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante ākārehi bhikkhu āpattim āpajjati iti
translated: “In how many ways, Venerable Sir, does a monk commit an offense?”

original: “Pañcahupāli, ākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: pañcahupāli ākārehi bhikkhu āpattim āpajjati
translated: “In five ways, Upāli.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: In what five ways?

original: Alajjitā, aññāṇatā, kukkuccapakatatā, akappiye kappiyasaññitā, kappiye akappiyasaññitā—
analyzed: a lajji tā aññāṇa tā kukkucca pakata tā akappiye kappiya saññi tā kappiye akappiya saññi tā
translated: Lack of conscience, lack of knowledge, being prone to forget, perceiving what is contrary to the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law, perceiving what is the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahā ākārehi bhikkhu āpattim āpajjati
translated: In these five ways a monk commits an offense.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañcahā ākārehi bhikkhu āpattim āpajjati
translated: In another five ways a monk commits an offense.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: In what five ways?

original: Adassanena, assavanena, pasuttakatā, tathāsaññī, satisammosā—
analyzed: a dassanena a ssavanena pasuttaka tā tathāsaññī sati sammosā
translated: Not having seen, not having heard, being asleep, perceiving it as right, forgetting.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjatī”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahā ākārehi bhikkhu āpattim āpajjati iti
translated: A monk commits an offense by these five means.”

original: “Kati nu kho, bhante, verā”ti?
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante
translated: “Sir, how many kinds of enmity are there?”

original: “Pañcime, upāli, verā.🔽Katame pañca?
analyzed: pañcime upāli verā  katame pañca
translated: “There are five kinds of enmity:

original: Pāṇātipāto, adinnādānaṁ, kāmesumicchācāro, musāvādo, surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānaṁ—
analyzed: pāṇa atipātaḥ adinna ādāna kāmesu micchā ācāraḥ musāvādaḥ surā meraya majja ppamāda ṭṭhāna
translated: killing living beings, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, and negligence in alcohol.”

original: ime kho, upāli, pañca verā”ti.
analyzed: ime khalu upāli pañca
translated: “There are these five kinds of enmity.”

original: “Kati nu kho, bhante, veramaṇiyo”ti?🔽“Pañcimā, upāli, veramaṇiyo.
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante veramaṇiyā ti  pañcimāḥ veramaṇiyaḥ
translated: “Sir, how many kinds of abstention from enmity are there?”

original: Katamā pañca?
analyzed: katamā pañca
translated: “There are five kinds of abstention from enmity:

original: Pāṇātipātā veramaṇī, adinnādānā veramaṇī, kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī, musāvādā veramaṇī, surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇī—
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā veramaṇī adinna ādānā veramaṇī kāmesu micchā ācārā veramaṇī musāvādā veramaṇī surā meraya majja ppamāda ṭṭhānā veramaṇī
translated: abstention from killing living beings, abstention from taking what is not given, abstention from sexual misconduct, abstention from lying, and abstention from negligence in alcohol.”

original: imā kho, upāli, pañca veramaṇiyo”ti.
analyzed: imā khalu upāli pañca
translated: “There are these five kinds of abstention from enmity.”

original: “Kati nu kho, bhante, byasanānī”ti?
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante byasanāni iti
translated: “Sir, how many kinds of misfortune are there?”

original: “Pañcimāni, upāli, byasanāni.🔽Katamāni pañca?
analyzed: pañcimāni upāli byasanāni  katamāni pañca
translated: “There are five kinds of misfortune:

original: Ñātibyasanaṁ, bhogabyasanaṁ, rogabyasanaṁ, sīlabyasanaṁ, diṭṭhibyasanaṁ—
analyzed: ñāti byasana bhoga byasana roga byasana sīla byasana diṭṭhi byasana
translated: misfortune concerning relatives, misfortune concerning wealth, misfortune concerning sickness, misfortune concerning virtue, and misfortune concerning views.”

original: imāni kho, upāli, pañca byasanānī”ti.
analyzed: imāni khalu upāli pañca byasanāni iti
translated: “There are these five kinds of misfortune.”

original: “Kati nu kho, bhante, sampadā”ti?
analyzed: kati nu khalu bhante sampadāti
translated: “How many kinds of success are there?”

original: “Pañcimā, upāli, sampadā.🔽Katamā pañca?
analyzed: pañcimā upāli sampadā  katamā pañca
translated: “There are five kinds of success:

original: Ñātisampadā, bhogasampadā, ārogyasampadā, sīlasampadā, diṭṭhisampadā—
analyzed: ñāti sampadā bhoga sampadā ārogya sampadā sīla sampadā diṭṭhi sampadā
translated: success in terms of relatives, success in terms of wealth, success in terms of health, success in terms of morality, and success in terms of view.

original: imā kho, upāli, pañca sampadā”ti.
analyzed: imā khalu upāli pañca
translated: These are the five kinds of success.”

original: Musāvādavaggo niṭṭhito sattamo.
analyzed: musāvāda vaggaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ sattamaḥ
translated: The seventh sub-chapter on lying is finished.

original: Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The summary:

original: Musāvādo ca omaddi,
analyzed: musāvādaḥ ca omaddi
translated: Lying, and also slander,

original: aparehi anuyogo;
analyzed: aparehi anuyogaḥ
translated: and also pursuing,

original: Āpattiñca aparehi,🔽verā veramaṇīpi ca;
analyzed: āpattiñca aparehi  verā veramaṇīpi ca
translated: and also offenses,🔽and also enemies, and also refraining,

original: Byasanaṁ sampadā ceva,
analyzed: byasanam sampadā ca iva
translated: and also misfortune, and also success:

original: sattamo vaggasaṅgahoti.
analyzed: sattamaḥ vagga saṅgaho ti
translated: the seventh sub-chapter is concluded.

original: 8. Bhikkhunovādavagga
analyzed: bhikkhunovāda vagga
translated: The sub-chapter on instructing the nuns

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṁ kātabban”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhuni saṅghena iva kammam kātabbanti
translated: “Sir, when a monk has how many qualities, should the Sangha do a legal procedure against him, instructing the Sangha of nuns?”

original: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṁ kātabbaṁ, avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena.
analyzed: pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhuni saṅghena iva kammam a vandiyaḥ saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhuni saṅghena
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, the Sangha should do a legal procedure against him, instructing the Sangha of nuns. A monk who has these five qualities is not fit to instruct the nuns.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What five?

original: Vivaritvā kāyaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ dasseti, ūruṁ dasseti, aṅgajātaṁ dasseti, ubho aṁsakūṭe dasseti, obhāsati, gihī sampayojeti—
analyzed: vivaritvā kāyam bhikkhunīnam dasseti ūrum dasseti aṅga jātam dasseti ubho asakūṭe dasseti obhāsati gihī sampayojā iti
translated: She exposes her body to the nuns, her thighs, her genitals, her breasts, or her armpits; she makes sexual gestures; she makes sexual banter with householders.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhuni saṅghena iva kammam kātabba
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

original: Avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena.
analyzed: a vandiyaḥ saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhuni saṅghena
translated: The Sangha should not do a procedure of reconciliation against him.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṁ kātabbaṁ, avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhuni saṅghena iva kammam a vandiyaḥ saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhuni saṅghena  katamehi pañcahi
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:

original: Bhikkhunīnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, bhikkhunīnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, bhikkhunīnaṁ avāsāya parisakkati, bhikkhuniyo akkosati paribhāsati, bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi bhedeti—
analyzed: bhikkhunīnam alābhāya parisakkati bhikkhunīnam anatthāya parisakkati bhikkhunīnam avāsāya parisakkati bhikkhuniyaḥ akkosati paribhāsati bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi bhedeti
translated: he is trying to stop gains for the nuns; he is trying to stop the nuns from getting robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies; he is trying to harm the nuns; he abuses and reviles the nuns; he tries to cause schisms in the Sangha.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṁ kātabbaṁ, avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhuni saṅghena iva kammam a vandiyaḥ saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhuni saṅghena
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, the Sangha should do a legal procedure against him, instructing him to submit.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṁ kātabbaṁ, avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena.
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhuni saṅghena iva kammam a vandiyaḥ saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhuni saṅghena
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, the Sangha should do a legal procedure against him, instructing him to submit.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Bhikkhunīnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, bhikkhunīnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, bhikkhunīnaṁ avāsāya parisakkati, bhikkhuniyo akkosati paribhāsati, bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: bhikkhunīnam alābhāya parisakkati bhikkhunīnam anatthāya parisakkati bhikkhunīnam avāsāya parisakkati bhikkhuniyaḥ akkosati paribhāsati bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi sampayojeti
translated: He tries to stop the nuns from acquiring material gains; he tries to harm the nuns; he tries to get the nuns to lose their place of residence; he abuses and reviles the nuns; he associates with and befriends the nuns.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṁ kātabbaṁ, avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhuni saṅghena iva kammam a vandiyaḥ saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhuni saṅghena ati
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, the Sangha should do a legal procedure against him, instructing him to submit.”

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatāya bhikkhuniyā kammaṁ kātabban”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante aṅgehi samannāgatāya bhikkhuniyā kammam kātabbanti
translated: “When a nun has how many qualities, should a legal procedure be done against her?”

original: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatāya bhikkhuniyā kammaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahupāli aṅgehi samannāgatāya bhikkhuniyā kammam kātabba

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi

original: Vivaritvā kāyaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dasseti, ūruṁ dasseti, aṅgajātaṁ dasseti, ubho aṁsakūṭe dasseti, obhāsati, gihī sampayojeti—
analyzed: vivaritvā kāyam bhikkhūnam dasseti ūrum dasseti aṅga jātam dasseti ubho asakūṭe dasseti obhāsati gihī sampayojā iti
translated: She exposes her body to the monks, she exposes her thighs to the monks, she exposes her genitals to the monks, she exposes both shoulders to the monks, she speaks indecently to the monks, she associates inappropriately with householders.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatāya bhikkhuniyā kammaṁ kātabbaṁ.

analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatāya bhikkhuniyā kammam kātabba
translated: There are five other qualities that should be taken as grounds for a legal procedure.

analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What are the five?

original: Aparisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, aparisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, aparisuddhājīvo hoti, bālo hoti, abyatto, na paṭibalo anuyuñjiyamāno anuyogaṁ dātuṁ—
analyzed: a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ hoti a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ hoti a parisuddha ājīvaḥ hoti bālaḥ hoti abyattaḥ na paṭibalaḥ anuyuñjiyamānaḥ anuyogam dātu
translated: He has impure bodily conduct; he has impure verbal conduct; he has impure livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent; and he’s unable to respond to questions when questioned.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na ṭhapetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na ṭhapetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has any of these five qualities shouldn’t give instruction to the nuns.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na ṭhapetabbo.
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na ṭhapetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has five other qualities shouldn’t give instruction to the nuns.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?🔽Kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi  kāyikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti vācasikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti kāyika vācasikena
translated: What are the five?

original: anācārena samannāgato hoti, bhikkhunīnaṁ akkosakaparibhāsako hoti, bhikkhunīhi saddhiṁ🔽saṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikena saṁsaggena—
analyzed: anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti bhikkhunīnam akkosaka paribhāsakaḥ hoti bhikkhunīhi saddhi  sa saṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikena sa saggena
translated: He has bad bodily conduct; he has bad verbal conduct; he has bad bodily and verbal conduct; he abuses and reviles the nuns; and he lives in association with householders, in a way that’s not in accordance with the Teaching.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na ṭhapetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na ṭhapetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has any of these five qualities shouldn’t give instruction to the nuns.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na ṭhapetabbo.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na ṭhapetabbaḥ  katamehi pañcahi
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, he shouldn’t cancel the instruction of the nuns.🔽He’s shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk.🔽He’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha.

original: Alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca, bhaṇḍanakārako ca hoti kalahakārako, sikkhāya ca na paripūrikārī—
analyzed: alajjī ca hoti bālo ca apakatatto ca bhaṇḍana kārako ca hoti kalaha kārako sikkhāya ca na paripūri kārī
translated: He doesn’t fulfill the training.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na ṭhapetabbo”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na ṭhapetabbaḥ ti
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, he shouldn’t cancel the instruction of the nuns.”

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na gahetabbo”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na gahetabbaḥ iti

original: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na gahetabbo.🔽Katamehi pañcahi?🔽Kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena
analyzed: pañcahi upāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na gahetabbaḥ  katamehi pañcahi  kāyikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti vācasikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti kāyika vācasikena
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, he shouldn’t give instruction to the nuns.🔽He’s lacking in virtue;🔽he’s lacking in conduct;🔽he’s lacking in view;

analyzed: anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti bhikkhunīnam akkosaka paribhāsakaḥ hoti bhikkhunīhi saddhi

original: saṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikena saṁsaggena—
analyzed: sa saṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikena sa saggena
translated: he’s socializing inappropriately;

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na gahetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na gahetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has any of these five qualities shouldn’t give instruction to the nuns.

original: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na gahetabbo.
analyzed: aparehi pi upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na gahetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give instruction to the nuns.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi

original: Alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca, gamiko vā hoti, gilāno vā—
analyzed: alajjī ca hoti bālaḥ ca apakatattaḥ ca gamikaḥ vā hoti gilānaḥ vā
translated: He’s shameless; he’s ignorant; he’s not skilled; he’s going away; he’s sick.

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṁ ovādo na gahetabbo”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam ovādaḥ na gahetabbaḥ iti

original: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ na sākacchitabbo.
analyzed: pañcahupāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhim na sākacchitabbaḥ
translated: “A monk who has five qualities should not converse with another monk.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: Which five?

original: Na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato
analyzed: na asekkhena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na asekkhena samādhi kkhandhena samannāgataḥ
translated: He’s not perfected in virtue; he’s not perfected in conduct; he’s not perfected in view; he’s not perfected in livelihood; he’s not perfected in wisdom;

analyzed: hoti na asekkhena paññā kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na asekkhena vimutti kkhandhena
translated: he does not possess the aggregate of wisdom of one beyond training, he does not possess the aggregate of freedom of one beyond training,

original: samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: samannāgataḥ hoti na asekkhena vimutti ñāṇa dassana kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti

original: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ na sākacchitabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli pañca haṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhim na sākacchitabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t converse with another monk.

original: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ sākacchitabbo.
analyzed: pañcahupāli aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhim sākacchitabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has five qualities may converse with another monk.

analyzed: katamehi pañcahi  asekkhena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti asekkhena samādhi kkhandhena samannāgataḥ  hoti asekkhena paññā kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti asekkhena vimutti kkhandhena samannāgataḥ
